Chat.RegainedUses: In addition, they recovered the following:
Chat.SongOfRestSelf: {name} enjoys their own Song of Rest.
Chat.ConsumedBothDayWorth: {actorName} consumed {itemName} for a full day's worth of food and water.
Chat.ConsumedBoth: {actorName} consumed {itemName} for {charges} units of food and water.
Chat.ConsumedFoodDayWorth: {actorName} ate {itemName} for a full day's worth of food.
Chat.ConsumedWaterDayWorth: {actorName} drank {itemName} for a full day's worth of water.
Chat.RequiredSatedFood: They require {units} units of food to be sated for the day.
Chat.RequiredSatedWater: They require {units} units of water to be sated for the day.
Chat.SatedFood: They don't require any more food today.
Chat.SatedWater: They don't require any more water today.
Chat.FoodFullNone: They ate enough of their own food to be sated today.
Chat.FoodHalfNone: They ate of their own food, but only half of the amount that they needed today.
Chat.FoodHalfHalf: They ate from an external source and of their own food to be sated today.
Chat.FoodNoneFull: They ate enough food from an external source to be sated today.
Chat.FoodNoneHalf: They ate from an external source, but only half of the amount that they needed today.
Chat.WaterFullNone: They drank enough of their own water to be sated today.
Chat.WaterHalfNone: They drank of their own water, but only half of the amount that they needed today.
Chat.WaterHalfHalf: They drank from an external source and of their own water to be sated today.
Chat.WaterNoneFull: They drank enough water from an external source to be sated today.
Chat.WaterNoneHalf: They drank from an external source, but only half of the amount that they needed today.
Chat.NoExhaustion: But they managed to avoid exhaustion.
Chat.Exhaustion: Thus, they suffered {exhaustion} levels of exhaustion.
Chat.ExhaustionDeath: Regrettably, {actorName} reached 6 levels of exhaustion and perished.
Chat.ExhaustionArmor: They chose to keep their heavy armor on, and recovered none of their exhaustion.
Chat.HitDiceArmor: They recovered less hit dice than normal because they rested in heavy armor.
Chat.NoHitDiceArmor: They recovered none of their hit dice because they rested in heavy armor.
Chat.HitDiceNoArmor: They chose to not rest in heavy armor, and regained the normal amount of hit dice.

SaveProfile.Title: Create New Module Profile
SaveProfile.OverrideProfile: Your new profile cannot have the same name as an old profile
SaveProfile.Empty: Your new profile cannot have an empty name

DiscardChanges.Title: Unsaved Changes
DiscardChanges.Content: You have unsaved changes to this profile. Are you sure you want to switch profile?

ResetDefaultChanges.Title: Reset default setting
ResetDefaultChanges.Content: Are you sure you want to reset the "Default" module profile to its default values?

DeleteProfile.Title: Delete profile
DeleteProfile.Content: Are you sure you want to delete the "{profile}" module profile?

ShortRest.NoHitDiceRest: Take a short rest? On a short rest you may recover primary or secondary resources.
ShortRest.SpellSlotsLeft: You have {spellSlotsLeft} levels of spell slots left to recover.
ShortRest.NoFeatureUse: You do not have any uses left of your {featureName}, so you cannot regain any spell slots during this short rest.
ShortRest.FullSpells: You're full on spells, you have no need to regain any spell slots.
ShortRest.NoMoreRestsSmall: You have have no more capacity for a short rest, as your game's rules mandate a maximum of {max_short_rests} per long rest.
ShortRest.ShortRestLimit: You have {num_short_rests} short rests remaining before you must take a long rest.
ShortRest.ShortRestLimitSmall: Your game's rules mandate a maximum of {max_short_rests} per long rest.
ShortRest.MinHitDiceSpend: You must spend {min_spend} hit dice to finish this short rest.
ShortRest.MaxHitDiceSpend: You can only spend {max_spend} hit dice during this short rest ({current} left).

ShortRestHealthWarning.Title: Finish Short Rest?
ShortRestHealthWarning.Content: You haven't spent any hit dice to regain hit points, are you sure you want to finish your short rest?

ShortRestHitDice.Title: Spend Hit Dice?
ShortRestHitDice.Content: You need to spend at least {num_dice} hit dice to finish this short rest. Are you sure you want to do this?

ShortRestNoHitDice.Title: No remaining hit dice
ShortRestNoHitDice.Content: You need to spend at least {num_dice} hit dice to finish this short rest, but you do not have any left.

LongRest.BeginExplanation: By beginning your long rest, you will regain some of your hit dice so that you can roll them to regain hit points.
LongRest.CustomRules: You are playing with custom rules, which means that you may regain hit points, hit dice, class resources, limited use item charges, and spell slots differently.
LongRest.FoodRequirement: You need to eat another {food} units of food today.
LongRest.WaterRequirement: You need to drink another {water} units of water today.
LongRest.FoodAlmostExhaustion: If you finish this day without having eaten the full amount of food, you will automatically suffer 1 level of exhaustion in {days} days.
LongRest.FoodExhaustion: Because you are starving, you will automatically suffer 1 level of exhaustion if you finish this day without having eaten the full required amount of food.
LongRest.NoWater: You will automatically suffer {exhaustion} levels of exhaustion if you finish this day having drank less than half of the requirement amount of water.
LongRest.HalfWater: You must make a DC {dc} Constitution saving throw or suffer {exhaustion} levels of exhaustion if you finish this day without drinking the full amount.
LongRest.DragDrop: Drag and drop items to consume, or select:
LongRest.DayWorth: One use of item worth entire day of {type}
LongRest.ExternalFood: Has access to external food source
LongRest.ExternalWater: Has access to external water source
LongRest.HeavyArmorRecovery: Remove Heavy Armor During Long Rest?
LongRest.HeavyArmorRecoveryHint: Since you have heavy armor equipped, you will suffer penalties. Click on the orange custom rules text to see how it impacts you.

LongRestWarning.Title: Finish Long Rest?
LongRestWarning.Content: You haven't spent any hit dice to regain hit points, are you sure you want to finish your long rest?

LongRestSettingsDialog.Title: Long Rest Settings
LongRestSettingsDialog.Content: These are the settings your GM configured for long rests in this game.

ModuleConfig.Title: Rest Recovery Configuration
ModuleConfig.Donate: If you like this module, consider donating to keep it running!
ModuleConfig.MoreToCome: And with more configuration options to come...

ItemOverrides.Title: Rest Recovery: Food & Water
ItemOverrides.DayWorth: One charge worth entire day worth
ItemOverrides.ChargesDescription: Rest Recovery's food and water system requires the item to have charges to be used - one charge equals one unit of food or water.

AbilityUse.Title: Select how much of this item you want to consume:
AbilityUse.DayWorthTitleBoth: This type of consumable is worth an entire day worth of both food and water.
AbilityUse.DayWorthTitleFood: This type of consumable is worth an entire day worth of food.
AbilityUse.DayWorthTitleWater: This type of consumable is worth an entire day worth of water.
AbilityUse.DayWorthTitleCont: You will not need to consume anything of that type until the next day. You cannot eat half of this type of consumable.
AbilityUse.SatedFood: You are already sated, you will gain no benefits from eating this.
AbilityUse.NotSatedFood: You need to eat {units} units to be sated.
AbilityUse.SatedWater: You are already sated, you will gain no benefits from drinking this.
AbilityUse.NotSatedWater: You require {units} units of water to be sated.

HitDieBonus.Title: Hit Die Bonus
HitDieBonus.Hint: Whenever this character rolls a hit die, this applies a bonus to that roll. This can be a formula, like "1d6 + 3".

FoodUnitsPerDay.Title: Units of food required per day
FoodUnitsPerDay.Hint: This overrides how many units of food this character needs per day.

WaterUnitsPerDay.Title: Units of water required per day
WaterUnitsPerDay.Hint: This overrides how many units of water this character needs per day.

NoFoodWater.Title: Disable Food & Water Requirement
NoFoodWater.Hint: If enabled, this character does not require any food or water, similar to the Undying Nature warlock feature.

Configure.Title: Module Configuration
Configure.Label: Configure Rest
Configure.Hint: You can configure how rests work in this dialog.

QuickHDRoll.Title: Quick-roll Hit Dice (skip dialog)
QuickHDRoll.Hint: Skip the dialog for rolling hit dice and roll them quickly.

Debug.Title: Enable debugging
Debug.Label: Prints debug messages to the console

EnableAutoRollButton.Title: Enable hit dice auto roll button
EnableAutoRollButton.Hint: This adds a button to the long and short rest UI so that players can auto-roll hit dice until their HP is almost full.

EnableFoodAndWater.Title: Enable food and water automation
EnableFoodAndWater.Hint: This enables sub-features relating to food and water automation, as seen below.

DisableRollConsumableItems.Title: Disable rolling consumable items on rest
DisableRollConsumableItems.Hint: By default, if a character chooses to consume an item during their long rest, it will be rolled as if the character clicked on its roll button. This setting will disable this automatic roll.

FoodUnitsPerDay.Title: Units of food required per day
FoodUnitsPerDay.Hint: This configures how many units of food characters needs per day. Setting this to 0 disables food requirement altogether.

WaterUnitsPerDay.Title: Units of water required per day
WaterUnitsPerDay.Hint: This configures how many units of water characters needs per day. Setting this to 0 disables water requirement altogether.

ExternalFoodAccess.Title: Access to external food source
ExternalFoodAccess.Hint: This configures whether players will be able to pick "External Food Source" during long rests as a replacement for consumable items. "Full" means full access like in inns and cities, "Half" means limited access or poor food, "None" means wilderness or starvation.

ExternalWaterAccess.Title: Access to external water source
ExternalWaterAccess.Hint: Same as above, but for water. Keep in mind that "Half" and "None" will cause characters to experience exhaustion almost immediately unless they have access to consumable items.

AutomateFoodWaterExhaustion.Title: Automate food & water exhaustion
AutomateFoodWaterExhaustion.Hint: Enabling this makes it so that characters suffer exhaustion if they do not eat or drink enough. Requires long rest exhaustion automation to be enabled.

NoFoodDuration.Title: Maximum days with no food
NoFoodDuration.Hint: This configures how many days characters can survive without eating food before suffering from automatic exhaustion.

HalfWaterSaveDC.Title: Half water exhaustion DC
HalfWaterSaveDC.Hint: This configures the Constitution saving throw DC that characters must make if they drink only half of the required amount of water.

IgnoreInactive.Title: Ignore inactive player characters
IgnoreInactive.Hint: If you have a Bard with the Song of Rest or a Chef in your party, this will only consider them as present if the owning player is active and logged on.

MaxShortRests.Title: Maximum short rests per long rest
MaxShortRests.Hint: This prevents characters from taking short rests if they reach a number of short rests equal to this number. Taking a long rest resets this counter. Putting zero here disables this setting.

MinHitDieSpend.Title: Minimum hit die spend
MinHitDieSpend.Hint: This prevents characters from finishing a short rest if they do not spend this number of hit dice. Putting zero here disables this setting.

MaxHitDieSpend.Title: Maximum hit die spend
MaxHitDieSpend.Hint: This prevents characters from rolling hit dice once they have rolled hit dice equal to this setting. This can never be less than the "Minimum hit die spend" setting.

NoHitDice.Title: Disable hit dice rolls during short rests
NoHitDice.Hint: This prevents characters from rolling hit dice during short rests.

ResourcesRecoveryFraction.Title: Resources recovery fraction
ResourcesRecoveryFraction.Hint: The fraction of resources to recover on a short rest.

ItemUsesRecoveryFraction.Title: Item uses recovery fraction
ItemUsesRecoveryFraction.Hint: The fraction of item uses (items, consumables, etc.) to recover on a short rest, if the item has charges with limited uses per short rest.

FeatUsesRecoveryFraction.Title: Feat uses recovery fraction
FeatUsesRecoveryFraction.Hint: The fraction of feat uses to recover on a short rest, if the feature has charges with limited uses per short rest.

PactSpellSlotsLongRecoveryFraction.Title: Pact spell slots recovery fraction
PactSpellSlotsLongRecoveryFraction.Hint: The fraction of Warlock pact spell slots to recover on a short rest.

AutomateExhaustion.Title: Enable exhaustion automation
AutomateExhaustion.Hint: This makes it so that exhaustion is subtracted by 1 every long rest.

ExhaustionIntegration.Title: Exhaustion Module Integration
ExhaustionIntegration.Hint: This setting allows you to use other modules in order to apply their respective exhaustion active effects on characters.

RollHitDice.Title: Enable long rest hit dice rolls
RollHitDice.Hint: Enables the hit dice roll UI in the Long Rest dialog.

PreRegainHitDice.Title: Enable hit dice recovery before finishing long rest
PreRegainHitDice.Hint: This makes it so that hit dice are recovered before finishing the long rest, so that you can roll them as a part of this rest.

PreRegainHitDiceBuffer.Title: Enable hit dice max buffer
PreRegainHitDiceBuffer.Hint: This setting causes each character to always regain hit dice, even if it would put their hit dice above their maximum, so that no hit dice are wasted. Any unused hit dice over their maximum will disappear once the long rest is completed.

HitPointsRecoveryFraction.Title: Hit points recovery fraction
HitPointsRecoveryFraction.Hint: The fraction of hit points to recover on a long rest.

HitDiceRecoveryFraction.Title: Hit dice recovery fraction
HitDiceRecoveryFraction.Hint: The fraction of hit dice to recover on a long rest.

HitDiceRecoveryRounding.Title: Hit dice recovery rounding
HitDiceRecoveryRounding.Hint: How to round the number of hit dice recovered.

ResourcesRecoveryFraction.Title: Resources recovery fraction
ResourcesRecoveryFraction.Hint: The fraction of resources to recover on a long rest.

SpellSlotsRecoveryFraction.Title: Spell slots recovery fraction
SpellSlotsRecoveryFraction.Hint: The fraction of spell slots to recover on a long rest.

PactSpellSlotsLongRecoveryFraction.Title: Pact spell slots recovery fraction
PactSpellSlotsLongRecoveryFraction.Hint: The fraction of Warlock pact spell slots to recover on a long rest.

ItemUsesRecoveryFraction.Title: Item uses recovery fraction
ItemUsesRecoveryFraction.Hint: The fraction of item uses (items, consumables, etc.) to recover on a long rest.

FeatUsesRecoveryFraction.Title: Feat uses recovery fraction
FeatUsesRecoveryFraction.Hint: The fraction of feat uses to recover on a long rest.

DailyUsesRecoveryFraction.Title: Daily uses recovery fraction
DailyUsesRecoveryFraction.Hint: The fraction of daily uses to recover on a long rest (items with the "Day" recovery setting).

AutomateArmor.Title: Heavy armor long rest automation
AutomateArmor.Hint: With this enabled, heavy armor impedes long rests. Configure below how it impacts the long rest.

ArmorHitDiceRecoveryFraction.Title: Heavy armor hit dice recovery fraction
ArmorHitDiceRecoveryFraction.Hint: If the character is wearing heavy armor during the long rest, this is fraction of hit dice they recover on a long rest.

AutomateArmorExhaustion.Title: Heavy armor prevents exhaustion recovery
AutomateArmorExhaustion.Hint: When enabled and the character is wearing heavy armor during the long rest, they do not recover from exhaustion. Requires exhaustion automation to be enabled.

WizardClassName.Title: Wizard class name
WizardClassName.Hint: Here you can configure what the Wizard class is called in your game. This can be a localized string.

DruidClassName.Title: Druid class name
DruidClassName.Hint: Here you can configure what the Druid class is called in your game. This can be a localized string.

BardClassName.Title: Bard class name
BardClassName.Hint: Here you can configure what the Bard class is called in your game. This is used to determine who's Song of Rest to use. This can be a localized string.

ArcaneRecovery.Title: Arcane Recovery name
ArcaneRecovery.Hint: Here you can configure what a wizard's Arcane Recovery feature is called in your game. This can be a localized string.

NaturalRecovery.Title: Natural Recovery name
NaturalRecovery.Hint: Here you can configure what a druid's Natural Recovery feature is called in your game. This can be a localized string.

SongOfRest.Title: Song of Rest name
SongOfRest.Hint: Here you can configure what a bard's Song of Rest feature is called in your game. This can be a localized string.

ChefFeat.Title: Chef feat name
ChefFeat.Hint: Here you can configure what the Chef feat is called in your game. This can be a localized string.

ChefTools.Title: Chef Tools name
ChefTools.Hint: Here you can configure what the chef tools item is called in your game. This can be a localized string. Leave this blank if you want to disable chef requiring tools to use the feat.

DurableFeat.Title: Durable feat name
DurableFeat.Hint: Here you can configure what the Durable feat is called in your game. This can be a localized string.

PeriaptItem.Title: Periapt of Wound Closure name
PeriaptItem.Hint: Here you can configure what the Periapt of Would Closure item is called in your game. This can be a localized string.

WoundClosureBlessing.Title: Blessing of Wound Closure name
WoundClosureBlessing.Hint: Here you can configure what the Blessing of Would Closure feature is called in your game. This can be a localized string.

BlackBloodFeature.Title: Black Blood Healing name
BlackBloodFeature.Hint: Here you can configure what a Verdan's Black Blood Healing feature is called in your game. This can be a localized string.
